content.en: There are many days for the new year all over the world. Why? Well, different cultures use different calendars.
content.tw: 你知道世界新年的日子很不一樣嗎? 因為每一個文化有自己特別的月曆。

content.en: Today is New Year's Day on the calendar most countries use. It's solar. It uses the sun.
content.tw: 大部分的國家都是今天過新年，因為他們用陽曆來算時間。

content.en: Now it's month seven on a different calendar. Muslims use this calendar. It's lunar. It uses the moon. The new year is in June on the calendar that most countries use. It begins when a new moon comes.
content.tw: 但是對於伊斯蘭教徒而言，現在是陰曆的七月，他們用月亮計算時間，新年是在我們陽曆的六月。

content.en: In Taiwan, we say our calendar is lunar. But it's not! It uses the moon AND the sun! The new year begins when the new moon closest to the first day of spring comes. It's between January 21st and February 21st on the calendar most countries use.
content.tw: 那台灣也使用陰曆嗎? 其實我們的農曆，是同時用太陽跟月亮算時間! 新年會在春天第一個新月慶祝，通常在陽曆的1月21日到2月21日之間。

content.en: Now it's the Year of the Dragon. Soon it'll be the Year of the Snake!
content.tw: 現在是龍年，但我們很快就要迎接蛇年!

content.en: Tomorrow, we're talking about celebrations! How are you celebrating the New Year?
content.tw: 明天，我們要聊聊慶祝活動！你打算怎麼慶祝新年呢？

vocabulary.preface: 不同的文化，造成有的國家用陽曆，有的用陰曆。

content.text: 1. snake 蛇。Did you know this year is the Year of the Snake? 你可知道今年是蛇年?I thought it's the Year of the Dragon. 我以為是龍年。
2. January 一月。Guess I'm still stuck in last year's calendar. 我還卡在去年的月曆呢。You are always one month behind.你老是落後一個月。What's next? 之後會怎樣?Celebrating January in February? 二月時慶祝一月?
3. lunar 月球的。Well, at least I'm not tracking time with a lunar calendar.至少我不用陰曆計時。I like the lunar calendar! 我喜歡陰曆!
4. New Year 新年。It reminds me of when to eat zongzi or moon cake.它提醒我哪時候吃粽子或是月餅。My favorite one is still Lunar New Year's Eve dinner. 我最喜歡的還是年夜飯。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起複習單字。snake蛇 January一月 lunar月球的 New Year新年

quiz.question: 1. What kind of calendar do most countries use?
2. Who uses the calendar that's on month seven now??
3. What does a lunar calendar use?
options: c. The moon and the sun

title: Sailing the Humpback Highway to Help Save Humpbacks

content.en: The Maori are New Zealand's Indigenous people. Whales are important to them. These very big ocean animals gave the Maori meat, milk, oil, and more.
content.tw: 毛利人是紐西蘭原住民，座頭鯨對他們很重要，它提供了鯨魚肉、奶、魚油等資源。

content.en: The Maori went from Polynesia to New Zealand long ago. They say whales kept them safe on the sea. So the Maori are called "whale riders."
content.tw: 毛利人被稱為鯨魚騎士，他們認為很久以前是因為座頭鯨的保護，才能從波利尼西亞來到紐西蘭。

content.en: Every year, these whales swim from New Zealand to Polynesia. They swim one thousand six hundred kilometers! The way they go is called the "humpback highway."
content.tw: 每一年，座頭鯨從紐西蘭游到波利尼西亞，總共要游一千六百公里! 這條路線被稱為「座頭鯨公路」！

content.en: One hundred years ago, there were twenty thousand humpback whales. There are about ten thousand now. They need to be kept safe. The Maori want the world to know this.
content.tw: 一百年前，有兩萬頭座頭鯨，現在只剩下大約一萬頭。毛利人希望全世界知道，這些鯨魚需要被保護。

content.en: They sent ten Indigenous women sailors to the humpback highway. The sailors sailed a small Polynesian ship. This kind of ship has been used for thousands of years.
content.tw: 毛利人派出十個女水手，搭一種有千年歷史的小船，到「座頭鯨公路」。

content.en: The women took DNA from the humpback highway. Now New Zealand scientists can find out which whales are swimming there.
content.tw: 他們收集鯨魚DNA，讓紐西蘭的科學家研究游過那裡的鯨魚。

content.en: The sailors were heroes helping humpbacks!
content.tw: 這些水手是幫助座頭鯨的英雄！

vocabulary.preface: 座頭鯨是跟紐西蘭原住民毛利人關係密切，被當作保護神。

content.text: 1. big 大的。I wonder how big a humpback whale is. 我想知道座頭鯨有多大。It's very big, about 15 meters long. 很大，有十五公尺長。Oh my, that's as long as three cars put together! 天哪，那跟三部車放在一起那麼長!
2. ocean 海洋。Imagine seeing that ocean giant rising by your boat. 想想看就在你的船旁邊冒出這個海洋巨獸。That would be like in a movie! 那會像在電影裡一樣。
3. animal 動物。You're a good swimmer. 你很會游泳。You could then swim with the animal. 就可以跟那個動物一起游泳。
4. people 人群。Swimming with a humpback whale? 跟座頭鯨一起游泳? No, I'd prefer to swim with people. 不了，我比較喜歡跟人游泳。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有親眼見過鯨魚嗎?
big大的 ocean海洋 animal動物 people人群

2. What did researchers take from the sea during their trip?
3. How far do the whales swim to Polynesia?
options: a. One thousand six hundred kilometers
